titleStmt.title: By the Lord Deputy General, and General Governour of Ireland. A declaration concerning the pay, and clothing of the army. Tyrconnel, Whereas we are given to understand, that his Majesties forces, especially the foot, are in a miserable condition for want of thier due weekly subsistence; ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel)
Tyrconnel, Richard Talbot, Earl of, 1630-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andr. Crook and Sam. Helsham assigns of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and by Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-Street.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
"Given at His Majesties Castle of Dublin this 29th day of April, in the year 1687.".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
